channel.title: Passion
channel.description: Stories, Tutorials, Tech updates and News

item.title: How to create tag from git branch
item.description:
Checkout the git branch or hash which needs to be tagged

git checkout <hash or branch>

Checkout a branch or git hash

git tag -a "v1.0" -m "Creating the tag"

push all the tags to the repository

git push --tags
item.dc:creator: Chintan Patel
item.content:encoded:
Checkout the git branch or hash which needs to be tagged

git checkout <hash or branch>

Checkout a branch or git hash

git tag -a "v1.0" -m "Creating the tag"

push all the tags to the repository

git push --tags

item.title: How to update the stale git fork
item.description:
To contribute to the git repository, you must be forking that repository under your account.

For first time when you contribute and create the Pull Request the branches of parent and your repository are in sync. But what happens when the parent repository is updated and your forked repository is
item.dc:creator: Chintan Patel
item.content:encoded:
To contribute to the git repository, you must be forking that repository under your account.

For first time when you contribute and create the Pull Request the branches of parent and your repository are in sync. But what happens when the parent repository is updated and your forked repository is out-of-date?

There are two ways to update the fork:

  • Using Github
  • Using git cli

Using Github,

  1. Create a Pull Request
  2. Under Comparing changes view, do following changes:
    • Change "base fork" to your repository with develop or whatever branch required.
    • Change "head fork" to parent repository with develop or whatever branch required.
  3. Create Pull Request
  4. Merge the changes after proper verification and approval.

Using git cli

  1. Go to the repository and checkout the develop branch.
  2. Update the branch - git pull origin develop
  3. git pull https://github.com/otheruser/repo.git develop
  4. git push origin develop
Reference:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7244321/how-do-i-update-a-github-forked-repository

item.title: Using Vi editor
item.description:
Guide Audience

Not using Unix or Macbook Terminal because you are scared of vi or vim, this is the guide for you...!

Do not worry, this steps will make you familiar with commands.

Before we get started, download this sample file, to test this commands.

Modes in vi

There are
item.dc:creator: Chintan Patel
item.content:encoded:
Guide Audience

Not using Unix or Macbook Terminal because you are scared of vi or vim, this is the guide for you...!

Do not worry, this steps will make you familiar with commands.

Before we get started, download this sample file, to test this commands.

Modes in vi

There are three vi modes:

  • vi mode - This is to use cut, copy and paste commands.
    • Press ESC to return to vi mode.
  • input/insert mode
    • Press i to start insert mode
  • command mode - This is used editor settings like line numbers, file operations, etc.
    • Press : to start command mode

vi mode

Make sure that all the commands are performed in ESC mode.

Action: Cut

  • Navigate to a line
  • Press dd

Behavior: The line will disappear and saved in clipboard.

Action: Undo changes

  • Press u

Action: Redo changes

  • Press CTRL+r

Action: Copy

  • Navigate to a line
  • Press yy

Behavior: The line will disappear and saved in clipboard.

Action: Paste

  • Perform Cut/Copy action
  • Navigate to a line
  • Press pfor paste

Behavior: The line will appear in next line to the cursor.

some more vi mode commands...

Command Action
Press $ To End Of Line (EOL)
Press 0 To Start Of Line
Press :1 To jump to First line of File
Press :12 To jump to line #12 of the file
Press SHIFT+G To jump to Last line of File
Press dd To cut the line pointed by cursor
Type /search term and ENTER to search the word in file
Press w To jump the words in the line

Input / Insert Mode

Action: Edit the document

  • Always Press ESC, to clear modes and back to vi mode
  • Press i or a or o to start the insert mode

Behavior: This will behave like normal editor, use keyboard arrows to navigate between lines.

Command Mode

To Start this mode Press :<command>, following table shows the details of usages:

Command Action
:q to close the file
:w to save the file
:wq to save and close the file
:w newfile.txt to save as `newfile.txt`
:q! to close file without saving changes
:wq! to save and close file

item.title: Basic Unix Commands for Geek
item.description: Blog is about basic unix commands which every developer must know. These commands will make you feel better and more professional.
item.dc:creator: Chintan Patel
item.content:encoded:
Introduction

This document requires intermediate level of shell commands knowledge. For starters visit http://mally.stanford.edu/~sr/computing/basic-unix.html

Benefits of learning

  • Look professional
  • Quicker results
  • No need of mouse and clicks
  • Makes you feel good

Lets get started quickly...

  1. Basics
  2. Advanced

Basics

Commands

  • hostname
  • ls
  • rm
  • wc
  • grep
  • find
  • watch
  • top
  • tree

hostname

To get the hostname of the current system.

ls

ls -ltra

Say it loud l s minus l t r a

Always use ls -ltra for listing directories, it will show all hidden as well as arrange files as per last modified date.

rm

rm -rf

Say it loud r m minus r f

Used to remove directory/files forcefully.

Must be used carefully, as it deletes all files and folders within directory without prompt

wc

wc -l

Say it loud w c minus l

It will count number of lines in a file

grep

grep "<search string>" <filename>

Say it loud grep

Grep will search the string in the file and will print the line to standard output

find

find . -type f

Say it loud find dot minus type f

  • find - command
  • . - current directory
  • -type f - Only list files alternatively use type -d to find only directories

List all the files recursively in all folders of current directory.

watch

watch <command>

Say it loud watch
This command will re-run the command every 2 secs (by default).

Its good when you want to monitor or watch for files. eg. execute this command 

mkdir new_dir  
cd new_dir  
watch "ls -tlra"`

and open another terminal window 

cd new_dir  
touch new_file

The first window will show the new file added within 2 seconds.

For OSX, use brew install watch if command does not work

top

Say it loud top

Its command line activity monitor/ task manager for terminal

Suprise yourself with brew install htop and then use htop instead.

tree

tree -L 2

Say it loud tree minus L two

It will generate a tree view for directories and files with level 2

Install via brew install tree

Advanced

Combine find and grep command

List all the files in current directory with .js file extension

find . -type f | grep ".js$"

Combine find, xargs and grep command

List all the files in current directory with 'foo' word

find . -type f | xargs grep "foo"

Combine find, xargs and grep command with exclude some folders

List all the files in current directory with 'foo' word except file path having in node_modules and bower_components folder

find . -type f | egrep -v "\/node_modules\/|\/bower_components\/" | xargs grep "foo"

Search multiple strings in list of files

find . -type f | xargs egrep "foo|bar"

Search multiple string in list of files where all patterns are in a file

Create a file with string needs to be searched for: 

$ cat lookup-patterns-file
Output:  
foo  
bar  
matching-pattern

Search for all strings matching in file lookup-patterns-file against folders

find . -type f | xargs grep -f patterns-file

item.title: Comparing Package manager
item.description: Comparing the package manager for Node, Ruby and PHP, includes, default public repository, dependency command, dependency lock, etc.
item.dc:creator: Chintan Patel
item.content:encoded:
Following is the comparison in the different language:

Node Ruby PHP Java
Package Manager NPM Bundle Composer Maven
Install dependencies npm install bundle install composer.phar mvn install
Dependency file package.json Gemfile composer.json pom.xml
Locking Dependencies npm-shrinkwrap Gemfile.lock composer.lock -
Public Repository https://www.npmjs.com https://rubygems.org/ https://packagist.org/ Distributed between different sources

item.dc:creator: Chintan Patel
item.content:encoded:
I am a Full-Stack Developer and geek who is well experienced with Mongo-Express-Angular-Node (MEAN) and Unix/Linux-Apache-MySQL-PHP (LAMP) stack.

  • Portfolio
  • Breaking the Ice
  • My Networks
  • Methodology
  • Work Experience
  • Other Experiences

Portfolio

Picture Buddy

Winner at #OrlandoDevs Angular 2 Hack Night
We build a application which shows different images based on the distance data. We used Arduino board with Proximity sensor to get the distance. The NodeJS server receives the distance from the board, does minor calculated distance from millimeters (mm) to meters(m) and send to Angular 2 front-end using Socket.IO. Based on the distance of the object pointed to the proximity sensor, different images are displayed on web page.

Vote My hack

at #OrlandoDevs React Hack Night
We tried to build a simple voting application using ReactJS. This application uses React, NodeJS and Express.

Social Sentiment Analyzer - Angular 1

at NeoReach Hack
We build an application which uses MEAN stack. The application requests a twitter hash, gets the most recent 100 tweets and based on each tweet, shows the graph of how positive/negative/neutral users' emotions are. The system uses MongoLabs, Express 4, Angular 1.5, D3 graphs and NodeJS. The data is stored in MongoDB for future comparison.

Social Sentiment Analyzer - Angular 2

at Disney Angular 2 Hack Night
This application is the same as mentioned in previous section. This project demonstrate use of Angular 2.

Video Streaming Application

at Hack-a-thon
The application allows user to upload the music and videos. The application was hosted on Angular 1, Amazon Web Services(AWS). EC2 instances, S3, Cloudfront, Transcoders and DynamoDB services.

Breaking the Ice

  • I am Passionate about Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) for front-end JS framework like AngularJS and back-end scripts like (PHP/JavaScript). Undoubtedly worked on HTML/CSS, also, knows all IE Quirks. I am aware of CSS preprocessors like SASS, LESS, etc., used with Bootstrap 2/3, foundation or material design. In the past, I have used third-party bower components using bower package manager.

  • I am convinced that, using NodeJS, I can do anything from integrating Raspberry PI or Arduino to make a highly scalable clusters of the server network. The HTTP middleware Express and Restify, makes it possible to interact with the additional functionality to Node's performance.

  • I have contributed to Design and development of RESTful API's, these APIs handled user security using JWT token strategy.

  • Full understanding of database architecture with NoSQL and RDMS databases like MongoDB and MySQL.

  • I am very glad to work on Amazon Web Service (AWS), with different products listed below:

    • To execute my application used Elastic Cloud Compute (EC2)
    • To store my images, videos and files used Simple Storage Service (S3)
    • To send email with guarantee delivery to the User's mailbox using Simple Email Service (SES)
    • To schedule automatic tasks for encoding videos, audio and other document files to different formats Simple Workflow service (SWF)
    • MySQL database was hosted in Redundant Database Service (RDS)
    • To add content to CDN used Amazon CloudFront
    • Used Amazon CloudSearch to add search functionality on website

Methodology

  • Our team follows Agile and SCRUM development process
  • Bi-weekly Iterations using Version One, JIRA, etc.
  • Initially, used Waterfall model

Work Experience

Sr. Associate

at Cognizant Technology Solutions worked from May '15

The Digital Works space at Cognizant Technology Solutions provides services to Entertainment and Media companies to explore and start movement towards the new emerging technology like Cloud service, Mobile Apps and Analytics.

Since May '15, I am working as Software Architect at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts, Orlando, FL, to help develop Reference Architecture implementation of Single Page Application (SPA) and RESTful API server. Also, make some prescriptions and documents, for delivery teams to follow the standards and enhance with greater efficiency and resources. Below are the tasks listed of my day-to-day activities:

  • Worked on Internationalization(i18n) and Localization(l10n) techniques
  • Reusable code blocks using yeoman generators
  • Identify / Debug / Resolved Coding errors in NodeJS and AngularJS for delivery teams
  • Provide proper knowledge stream to other developers by internal company Web Cast
  • Improve Code Quality and Code Coverage if required for certain critical projects
  • Adding new features to existing applications or generators
  • Helping teams with writing Unit Test cases for Angular and NodeJS in karma, mocha and chai
  • Use Docker container to deploy the applications locally. These application later gets deployed at AWS Cloud or Disney's enterprise data center.

Software Engineer

at Tenlegs, LLC worked from Feb '11 - May '15

Tenlegs provides an innovative platform that brings together members of a school community onto one trusted network. We do this with a privately-branded online network that enables individuals to connect and collaborate, regardless of geography or discipline empowering schools to extend their presence globally.

I have worked at Tenlegs.com (my third startup experience), for more than 4 years as full-stack software developer. The technology includes - Linux, Apache web server, MySQL database and PHP language Stack, AngularJS, jQuery and Amazon AWS.

  • Introduced Angular / Node in new projects which improved the quality of product
  • Integrated vendor-based payment gateway using Paypal and Stripe APIs
  • Contributed to project for white labelling the client's website experience
  • Converted the whole site to CDN using Amazon Cloudfront and Amazon S3 services improved the image rendering to 20%.
  • Worked on CloudFront for Streaming the Video rather than progressive download, saving 30% of cost.
  • Improved the Video/Audio encoding time to 50% by moving the services to Amazon SWF from batch processes
  • Helped in the development of Deployment workflow for the releases reducing the downtime of the portal
  • Followed Agile process of development and co-ordinated with offshore team
  • Added new features to in-house PHP framework
  • Worked with UX team to create a pixel perfect HTML views
  • Migrated the source code repository from svn with git
  • Migrated the UI from Bootstrap v2 to Bootstrap v3

My Networks

  • Github
  • Twitter
  • LinkedIn
  • Hacker Rank

Other Experiences

  • Software Engineer Intern - Solar Metrology, New York
  • Freelancer - justgpstracking.com
  • Freelancer - quantum-wireless.com
  • Freelancer - jatched.com
  • Software Engineer - infosys.com
